description: From Middle English unholden, equivalent to un- +â€Ž hold.

verbs.description: unhold (third-person singular simple present unholds, present participle unholding, simple past unheld, past participle unheld or unholden)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To unhand, release from one's grasp, let go of.
(transitive, telephony) To remove from a "hold" or "on hold" state.
